module.name: incomplete_data_reference_mechanism
module.name.french: Mécanisme pour le référencement de données incomplètes

purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of product data intentionally incomplete. This application module provides specifications that enable, during data exchanges, to transfer partially some data when the remainder has been already transferred or will be transferred later.

inscope.li: Marking of product data, indicating that they are partially provided in the data exchange structure.

uof.name: Incomplete_data_reference_mechanism
uof.description:
The Incomplete data reference mechanism UOF specifies the data structure for the marking of product data as incompletely transferred.
Intentional incomplete data transfers are based on the following principles:
A 'reference' marking can only be used in case the referenced portion of product data can be retrieved by only its identifier, for example when it is supported by a PDM system. The instance that serves as the handle for a not completely exchanged portion of product data is explicitly classified as a 'reference'.
A sender shall provide a minimum of entities, attributes and attribute values, which are necessary to uniquely identify a referenced object. Otherwise a receiver shall interpret the same object as a new one because of different identifiers.
Other data associated to the referenced instance or group of instances shall not be instantiated.
A reference is applicable to an existing object at sender's and/or receiver's site or represents an object as a placeholder, that is, an instance may be referenced at a certain time of data exchange if it was exchanged before or if it will be exchanged later on.
Product data to which the incomplete data reference mechanism may be applied, include parts, documents and external files. In addition to the entities and attributes required to implement the reference flag some more entities are required to support the unique identification of referenced objects.
Parts : The entity, which is classified as a reference, is the Part_view_definition. The unique identification of a part requires the entities Part_view_definition, Part_version, Part. Additionally the entity Organization_or_person_in_organization_assignment is required to support the specification of an id owner.
Documents : The instance, which is classified as a reference, is the Digital_document_definition. The unique identification of a document requires the entities Digital_document_definition, Document_version and Document with their mandatory attributes. Additionally the entity Organization_or_person_in_organization_assignment is required to support the specification of an id owner.
External Files : the instance, which is classified as a reference, is a Digital_file. The unique identification of an external file requires the entities Digital_file, External_file_id_and_location and Document_location_property with their mandatory attributes.
